articles.title: So far, only one-third of Americans have ever used AI for work
articles.summary: A recent AP-NORC poll reveals that while 60% of US adults have utilized AI for information searches, only 37% have applied it to work tasks, highlighting a significant generational divide in adoption rates. Notably, AI companionship remains the least popular use, with only 16% of adults overall engaging with it, although this figure rises to 25% among those under 30, indicating both potential benefits and risks associated with AI interactions.
